action.action-desc: Ms. Alsobrooks (for herself and Ms. Lummis) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

form.official-title: To authorize the Secretary of Health and Human Services to award grants to increase early detection of and intervention for uterine fibroids, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Uterine Fibroid Intervention and Gynecological Health Treatment Act of 2025.

section.header: Research on uterine fibroid early detection and intervention

subsection.text: The Secretary of Health and Human Services (referred to in this Act as the Secretary) shall—

paragraph.text: conduct or support research on increasing early detection of, and intervention for, uterine fibroids; and
based on the results of such research and other relevant information, formulate evidence-based or evidence-informed strategies to increase early detection in health care settings.

subsection.text: The Secretary shall finalize the evidence-based or evidence-informed strategies required by subsection (a)(2) as expeditiously as possible in order to make such strategies available to grantees under section 3 to implement such strategies pursuant to section 3(b)(3).

section.header: Grants with respect to uterine fibroid early detection and intervention

subsection.text: The Secretary may award grants to States for carrying out programs—

paragraph.text: to increase early detection of, and intervention for, uterine fibroids; and
to develop and implement public awareness and education campaigns for the early detection of, and intervention for, uterine fibroids.

subsection.text: A State receiving a grant under this section may use the grant for the following activities, with respect to increasing early detection of, and intervention for, uterine fibroids:

paragraph.text: Screening procedures, including advanced gynecological imaging, including payment for such procedures.
Implementation of evidence-based or evidence-informed strategies formulated under section 2(a)(2).
Facilitating access to health care settings.

section.header: Research with respect to uterine fibroid early detection and intervention
section.text: The Secretary may award grants to States for the purpose of conducting research, which may include clinical trials, related to—

paragraph.text: disparities in pain control and management in uterine fibroid surgical treatment; or
Asherman’s Syndrome, intrauterine adhesions, and other intrauterine conditions, as the Secretary determines appropriate.

subsection.text: Not later 2 years after the initial award of grants under section 2 or 3, and every 2 years thereafter, the Secretary shall submit to Congress, and make publicly available on the website of the Department of Health and Human Services—

paragraph.text: a report summarizing the findings and results of programs and activities funded through grants awarded under this Act; and
a report outlining research developments and findings related to—

subparagraph.text: disparities in pain control and management in uterine fibroid surgical treatment; and
Asherman’s Syndrome, intrauterine adhesions, and other intrauterine conditions, as the Secretary determines appropriate.
